ImageData.LabelName: Anatomy of the Thyroid and Parathyroid Glands

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: REVISION: Made left side of the thyroid gland slightly narrower at the bottom than the right side to show the thyroid gland as asymmetrical, per comments from expert reviewer
Move the four parathyroids to the edge of the thymus nearer to the four thyroid poles.

Softened color of the larynx and trachea; faded muscles in the neck; faded the thyroid gland in the inset to make the parathyroid glands stand out; added white space between the two parts of the inset.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Anatomy of the thyroid and parathyroid glands; drawing shows the thyroid gland at the base of the throat near the trachea. An inset shows the front and back views. The front view shows that the thyroid is shaped like a butterfly, with the right lobe and left lobe connected by a thin piece of tissue called the isthmus. The back view shows the four pea-sized parathyroid glands. The larynx is also shown.

Anatomy of the thyroid and parathyroid glands; drawing shows the thyroid gland at the base of the throat near the trachea. An inset shows the front and back views. The front view shows that the thyroid is shaped like a butterfly, with the right lobe and left lobe connected by a thin piece of tissue called the isthmus. The back view shows the four pea-sized parathyroid glands. The larynx is also shown.

Captions.MediaCaption: Anatomy of the thyroid and parathyroid glands. The thyroid gland lies at the base of the throat near the trachea. It is shaped like a butterfly, with the right lobe and left lobe connected by a thin piece of tissue called the isthmus. The parathyroid glands are four pea-sized organs found in the neck near the thyroid. The thyroid and parathyroid glands make hormones.
Anatomy of the thyroid and parathyroid glands.

MediaContent.Comment: 2016-11-21: Added HP Caption and Content Description; ak
